legacy.full_text: For Chandler Malone and Sam Aguilar AI offers good news and bad news. The bad, of course, includes the potential to eliminate thousands of jobs. But for entrepreneurs, there’s also a lot of promise, offering ways to jumpstart companies and build platforms much faster than ever

value.string_value: AI platform Bootup Studios targets newbie founders. “We’re helping people move from being displaced by AI to being empowered by it,” says cofounder Chandler Malone.
This Startup Leans Into AI To Help Novice Founders Move Fast

legacy.description: Sign up now for Forbes' free daily newsletter for unmatched insights and exclusive reporting: https://t.co/v3UAa9BzAT
legacy.name: Forbes

result.text:
For Chandler Malone and Sam Aguilar AI offers good news and bad news. The bad, of course, includes the potential to eliminate thousands of jobs. But for entrepreneurs, there’s also a lot of promise, offering ways to jumpstart companies and build platforms much faster than ever before.

That’s what got them thinking about the potential for using AI to help would-be entrepreneurs with an idea but not much else. To that end, in August, they launched Bootup Studios, an AI platform aimed at helping newbie founders go from initial concept to customer discovery, product development, and go-to-market strategy.  https://t.co/5DPKOHn3lH
